references.paper_title: The multiplicative weights update method: A meta-algorithm and applications
references.reason: This paper provides a foundational algorithm for no-regret learning, which is central to the analysis of learning agents in repeated games.
This paper introduces the foundational multi-armed bandit problem, which is a key model for online learning in uncertain environments, a setting relevant to contracting with learning agents.
This paper directly addresses the problem of designing contracts against no-regret learners, providing a crucial benchmark for the current work.
This paper develops the framework for analyzing repeated games against no-regret learners, directly informing the techniques used in this paper to analyze repeated contracts.
This paper provides a foundational analysis of the optimal static contract design, which serves as a benchmark for the repeated contract setting considered in the current paper.
